Capability Narrative (Plain Text):
#THIS ORGANIZATION has a defined @Software Development Life Cycle Process for software development on #THIS SYSTEM. The @Product Manager and @Developer review product requirements and create user stories in @unknown.
@Developer uses @unknown for standard naming conventions, creating branches, and running automated tests.
After coding is completed, the @Developer ensures that the requirements are satisfied, attaches a code review template, and marks it "under review." @unknown automatically runs a suite of tests to ensure #THIS SYSTEM is working correctly.
The @DevOps Admin lead completes the final review of changes and pushes them from staging to production. The @DevOps Admin monitors the environment to ensure #THIS SYSTEM works correctly.

Capability Narrative (Plain Text):
Prior to onboarding, All personnel must acknowledge authentication credential safeguard requirements when signing the @Rules of Behavior Agreement. Authorized users receive their account information including a temporary password in person or via telephone after their identity is verified. Remote users receive their credentials via telephone. Users must change their temporary password immediately upon login.
If a user loses or compromises their password, they must create a helpdesk ticket in @unknown and the @Change Control Board resets and distributes the new password in person or via phone. Passwords and authenticators are encrypted in accordance with FIPS 140-2 using AES-256.

Capability Narrative (Plain Text):
The @Incident Response Admin manages @Incident Response Plan and updates the plan at least annually to ensure the @Incident Response Process is consistently applied across the #THIS ORGANIZATION. Changes to #THIS SYSTEM affecting the @Incident Response Plan are included in updates, which also address concerns or difficulties during implementation, execution, or testing.
To better ensure the @Incident Response Plan is helping meet #THIS ORGANIZATION incident response objectives, the @Incident Response Admin reviews these key metrics:
Number of alerts fired over x days
Number of requests received over x days
Number of investigations conducted over x days
Number of alerts closed over x days
Number of requests closed over x days
Number of investigations closed over x days
Number of hours spent on alerts, requests, and investigations
Number of tickets assigned by type and source

Tickets closed per Affected User Department
Mean Time to Respond
Mean Time to Resolve

If an information spill occurs within #THIS SYSTEM, the @Incident Response Admin follows the @Incident Response Plan to contain the incident.
The @Incident Response Admin coordinates with relevant business units to determine who will investigate and remediate the incident. They triage affected components, assess eradication steps, and investigate possible replication of data in other areas. #THIS ORGANIZATION provides annual information spillage training and conducts tabletop exercises.

Capability Narrative (Plain Text):
#THIS ORGANIZATION employs @unknown, a #PROGRAM TYPE-compliant platform, for access to #THIS SYSTEM, enforcing password rules through checking against a compromised list, secure transmission, salted key derivation storage, immediate password change on recovery, and user-friendly, complex password policies. All data, including passwords, are AES-256 encrypted as per FIPS 140-2.

The @Change Control Board configures @unknown authentication settings meet the following complexity requirements:
Case sensitive
Minimum of 15 characters
At least one upper-case letter
At least one lower-case letter
At least one numeric
At least one special character

Users receive a password change reminder 7 days before expiration. Passwords have a minimum lifetime of 1 day and maximum lifetime of 60 days, with at least 50% of the password being changed when creating a new one. #THIS ORGANIZATION doesn't allow password reuse for 24 generations.

Capability Narrative (Plain Text):
All personnel from #THIS ORGANIZATION must report any suspected or actual security incidents, including insider threats, to the @Incident Response Admin via email, as indicated in the @Incident Response Plan. Incidents should be reported within 1 hour of discovery, and the timeframes for different incident categories (see table) should be followed, unless the data owner specifies a more restrictive guidance.
Incident Category Description Impact Notification Time Requirement
1 Root Level Intrusion Moderate 2 Hours
2 User Level Intrusion Moderate 2 Hours
3 Unsuccessful Activity Attempt N/A 4 Hours
4 Denial of Service Mod/High 15 Minutes
5 Non-Compliance Activity N/A 4 Hours
6 Reconnaissance N/A 4 Hours
7 Malicious Logic Moderate 2 Hours
After formally documenting and discovering an incident, the responding party communicates updates and remediation actions to all appropriate stakeholders. The type of incident determines which stakeholders are notified, including the affected organizations, the @InfoSec Admin, @Operations Admin, and support organizations.
Stakeholders receive an email from the @Incident Response Admin, including the following information:
Issue name/identifier
Summary, impact
Current status
Stakeholders
Affected parties
Facts to date
Actions
How to learn more
Engagement/Update plan

Capability Narrative (Plain Text):
This is a notice for accessing a U.S. Federal Government Information System (FIS) provided for #THIS ORGANIZATION-authorized use only. By using this FIS, you agree to the following:
Access is restricted to authorized #THIS ORGANIZATION employees and contractors. Unauthorized use is prohibited and subject to criminal and civil penalties.

Security measures protect #THIS ORGANIZATION interests, not your personal benefit or privacy.

Capability Narrative (Plain Text):
The @InfoSec Admin ensures security is considered from system design to modification. They work with the @Product Manager and @Developer during development to ensure a well-designed and integrated system. Throughout the security lifecycle, responsible teams operate and maintain #THIS SYSTEM in accordance with security processes and technical requirements detailed in the @System Security Plan. 
These processes include, at a minimum: 
account management
onboarding and offboarding
security assessments
change management
secure configuration
disaster recovery
vendor maintenance
physical security
code development
vulnerability scanning, and 
logging/monitoring.

Capability Narrative (Plain Text):
#THIS ORGANIZATION requires all personnel that access #THIS SYSTEM agree to the @Rules of Behavior Agreement during the @Onboarding Process. The @Rules of Behavior Agreement is legally binding and requires all personnel to maintain personal accountability for practicing good and ethical security practices including:
confidentiality of authentication codes and devices,
using authentication codes only for approved business purposes, and
avoiding sharing passwords with other individuals.
transmitting and storing passwords in an encrypted state in accordance with FIPS 140-2 requirements within authorized components.
refraining from personal use of social media and posting organizational information on public websites while on work time or on equipment provided by #THIS ORGANIZATION.

All personnel are required to read and re-sign the @Rules of Behavior Agreement when revisions or updates are made, which happens at least annually.

Capability Narrative (Plain Text):
#THIS ORGANIZATION adheres to #PROGRAM TYPE Continuous Monitoring frequencies:
Ongoing monitoring of information system and auditable events, with incident reporting as necessary
Weekly audit review, analysis and reporting
Monthly vulnerability scanning, internal reporting of security status, flaw remediation, update of POA&M, and verification of security functions
Change/refresh authenticators every 60 days
Quarterly disablement of inactive user accounts
Annual activities including review and update of security policies and procedures, verification of continued access for account holders, security awareness and training, security assessment by a 3PAO, penetration testing, contingency plan training and testing, incident response training and testing, and review and update of access agreements and rules of behavior
Prevent reuse of identifiers every two years
Reauthorize #THIS SYSTEM every three years, and review and update position categorizations and risk assessments as necessary
Rescreen personnel every five years.

Capability Narrative (Plain Text):
The @DevOps Admin maintains a current baseline configuration of #THIS SYSTEM in @unknown, as outlined in the @Configuration Management Plan. This includes:
Hardening #THIS SYSTEM for security while maintaining functionality.
Enabling only essential ports, protocols, and services.
Ensuring associated accounts are secure and compliant.
Disabling non-essential functions, ports, protocols, and services.
Adhering to the principle of least privilege for device operations and access.

Authorized personnel approve, test, and deploy any changes to these baselines through the @Change Management Process, with updates documented in @unknown.

Capability Narrative (Paramified): [{"type":"p","children":[{"text":""},{"type":"smart-tag","value":"this-organization","children":[{"text":""}]},{"text":" implements an "},{"type":"mention","value":"Incident Response Process:ELEMENT","children":[{"text":""}]},{"text":" that includes:"}]},{"type":"ul","children":[{"type":"li","children":[{"text":"Preparation: Deploying monitoring technology, SIEM, Intrusion Detection, audit logging, automated alerting, and security training"}]},{"type":"li","children":[{"text":"Identification: Comprehensive logging, monitoring, and automated alerting for anomalies; manual monitoring by trained staff; and creating incident tickets to determine the anomaly's severity rating and best course of action"}]},{"type":"li","children":[{"text":"Containment: Discovering and defining steps to contain the issue, notifying affected parties via email, and conducting network and endpoint forensics"}]},{"type":"li","children":[{"text":"Eradication: Assessing actions required for long-term and/or permanent changes to prevent the issue from occurring again"}]},{"type":"li","children":[{"text":"Recovery: Restoring impacted systems, services, or functions to a full and secure operational status, with formal approval from the "},{"type":"mention","value":"Operations Admin:ELEMENT","children":[{"text":""}]},{"text":" and the "},{"type":"mention","value":"ISSO:ELEMENT","children":[{"text":""}]},{"text":""}]},{"type":"li","children":[{"text":"Lessons Learned: Collecting all notes and documents to identify opportunities to improve the "},{"type":"mention","value":"Incident Response Process:ELEMENT","children":[{"text":""}]},{"text":"."}]}]}]
Capability Narrative (Plain Text):
#THIS ORGANIZATION implements an @Incident Response Process that includes:
Preparation: Deploying monitoring technology, SIEM, Intrusion Detection, audit logging, automated alerting, and security training
Identification: Comprehensive logging, monitoring, and automated alerting for anomalies; manual monitoring by trained staff; and creating incident tickets to determine the anomaly's severity rating and best course of action
Containment: Discovering and defining steps to contain the issue, notifying affected parties via email, and conducting network and endpoint forensics
Eradication: Assessing actions required for long-term and/or permanent changes to prevent the issue from occurring again
Recovery: Restoring impacted systems, services, or functions to a full and secure operational status, with formal approval from the @Operations Admin and the @ISSO
Lessons Learned: Collecting all notes and documents to identify opportunities to improve the @Incident Response Process.

When a #THIS ORGANIZATION team seeks budget for services, they must outline functional requirements and conduct a cost-benefit analysis to decide between external vendors or internal development. 
If opting for a vendor, the @GRC Admin evaluates risks for compliance with #THIS SYSTEM's supply chain standards. 
Following the @GRC Admin's approval, the @Operations Admin grants final authorization for procuring the services.
